page.title: 01LANDSCAPE OF WESTONZOYLAND
page.content: We,the children of Westonzoyland County Primary School,Cheer Lane, Westonzoyland,Near Bridgwater,in the County of Somerset have enjoyed working together to produce the information on these pages for you. Our Village and its surroundings are very special.We are part of the Somerset Levels,a large area of low flat land which for thousands of years was flooded.Prehistoric man made track-ways across the marshes using woven branches.King Alfred burnt his cakes on these Levels.Monks in the Middle Ages began drainage of the area and this was carried in the 18th Century by Dutch engineers and in the 1800's steam pumping stations were used.The Last Battle on English soil was fought here and in World War II there was a large R.A.F.Station here,closing in 1952.
